channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-7315] Remove support for client-side RowLocks
item.description: See comments in HBASE-7263.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
• attached HBASE-7315.patch *

Removes support for user-level RowLocks.

I tried to minimize the changes to the interfaces as follows:

  • On the client side, replaces instances of RowLock with NullType. This is so that client code that only passed in a null RowLock, e.g. Get get = new Get(row, null) will still work.
  • On the server side, replaces instances of "Integer lockId" with NullType in the public methods of HRegion. This is so that coprocessors that call into HRegion directly will still function as long as they passed in "null" as the lockId.

This also means it was easier to not change all the tests . If it is preferred, I can do a follow on issue that removes the NullTypes.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12560314/HBASE-7315.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 18 new or modified tests.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/3488//console

This message is automatically generated.
Yeah I would vote for removing the NullTypes when possible. It seems like we have the ability to break compatibility very rarely so we should use that to clean up what we can.

Yeah I would vote for removing the NullTypes when possible. It seems like we have the ability to break compatibility very rarely so we should use that to clean up what we can.

Thanks for the input. Happy to do that in a later JIRA if this goes in.

• Very Minor Nit: In Hregion#checkAndMutate you create a get, passing a null. Since the null's always ignored it might be cleaner to use the other constructor. But whatever you think.

+1 looks good to me.
I sent an e-mail to the dev list discussing the change. If there isn't objection over there, I'll commit after addressing your nit.
Can we even remove the NullType from Increment, Append, etc. It's fine to break client code I think, and leaving this around is just going to be confusing.

This message is automatically generated.

Thanks for removing the NullType.

  • TestAccessController has a new import since you uploaded your patch.
  • HRegion#getLock doesn't appear to have any where that the first parameter is ever used.
  • BatchOperationInProgress doesn't need to take in pairs anymore, as far as I can see.

Thanks for the review.

TestAccessController has a new import since you uploaded your patch.

Thanks, will fix in new version

# HRegion#getLock doesn't appear to have any where that the first parameter is ever used.

BatchOperationInProgress doesn't need to take in pairs anymore, as far as I can see

checkAndMutate needs it, because it holds the row lock over the entire (check, mutate) operation. So the mutate part needs to take an existing rowlock.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Removes API that allowed client to grab and hold and then later release a rowlock: e.g. HTable#lockRow and HTable#unlockRow. It was a bad idea.
